laboratory_examinations.findings: Estimated pulmonary artery systolic pressure (PASP) was 80 mmHg.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: In July 2016, PASP increased to 120 mmHg.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Estimated PASP was 120 mmHg. Femoral artery oxygen saturation was 93.4%.
Revealed an enlarged hilar shadow and widened pulmonary arteries; no parenchymal lesions were discerned.
Pulmonary artery pressure (PAP) was 60/39 mmHg, lower than aortic pressure. Femoral artery oxygen saturation was 88.5%.

laboratory_examinations.procedure_name: Plasma N-terminal pro-brain natriuretic peptide test
laboratory_examinations.findings: Plasma N-terminal pro-brain natriuretic peptide was 94.2 pg/ml.

laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Estimated PASP decreased from 55 mmHg in March 2021 to 47 mmHg in June 2022.
Estimated PASP decreased from 47 mmHg in June 2022 to 45 mmHg in February 2023.
